issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem isn't valid and it can't be fixed.
resolution.name: Invalid

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.environment:
Linux  2.6.32-220.13.1.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Mar 29 11:46:40 EDT 2012 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

This machine is KEONIZED ie., KEON BoKS security is implemented for this box

comments.body:
As per this, I feel the login user Id is not getting picked .. Kindly help 
https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/common/branches/HADOOP-6685/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/UserGroupInformation.java

A configuration problem, not a bug in hadoop, Closing as invalid. Sorry

see: [https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/InvalidJiraIssues]

Hi Steve,

Can you suggest any workaround for my problem.

Regards,
Vijay
no. Follow the link for suggestions on how to go about addressing problems like that, the key one being: not via JIRA

For future readers:
I encountered this exact problem while trying to run the NameNode on Docker, and the issue was `hdfs` having one UID when running `hdfs namenode -format` and a different UID when starting `hdfs namenode`. I suppose mismatches between `supergroup` and `hadoop` could potentially cause this too.
